content:
As a business, there are various resources you can give your customers depending on your niche, product, and marketing strategy. Here are a few examples:

1. E-books or whitepapers - These are informational resources that provide value to your customers. They can be used to educate your customers about your product or niche, or to help them solve specific problems.
2. Webinars or video courses - These resources can be used to provide in-depth training on a specific topic or skill. They can be used to establish your expertise and authority in your niche.
3. Podcasts or audio courses - These can be used to provide your customers with regular updates or insights into your niche or industry. They can also be used to share success stories or interview experts.
4. Templates or checklists - These are practical resources that provide your customers with actionable steps to follow. They can help your customers save time and effort by providing a clear roadmap to follow.
5. Community or forum - A community or forum can be used to provide your customers with a platform to ask questions, share ideas, and connect with other like-minded individuals. It can help build a sense of community and loyalty around your brand.
6. Personalized consultations or coaching - These resources can be used to provide your customers with one-on-one support and guidance. This can help them achieve their goals more quickly and effectively.
7. Free trials or samples - These resources can be used to allow your customers to test out your product or service before committing to a purchase. This can help build trust and confidence in your brand.

Remember, the type of resource you offer should be aligned with your marketing strategy and your customers' needs and preferences.
